properties.name: Suntech
properties.information: New Initial 30MW capacity of Production with a potential of 50 MW of Production and the employment of 150 people by the end of 2011.

properties.name: Princeton Power Systems
properties.information: The production capability for inverters is now over 12 megawatts (MW) annually, and will reach over 40 MW in 2012.

properties.name: Conergy
properties.information: A 100 megawatt, ?5 million production site for solar mounting systems will accompany the Conergy production site in Frankfurt, Germany of 250MW.

properties.name: Suniva
properties.information: The new manufacturing plant expanded its production capacity to 170M from 96 MW by adding a third cell line at its metro-Atlanta plant.

properties.name: AQT
properties.information: The South Carolina factory will eventually produce 1 GW of CIGS PV solar panels by the end of 2014 and employ 1,000 people.

properties.name: AQT
properties.information: The factory is home to a current 15MW production plant of CIGS PV solar panels that will expand to a 30MW production facility by the end of 2011.

properties.name: Stion
properties.information: Stion, a manufacturer of CIGS high-efficiency thin-film solar panels, will build a new 100MW production facility in Hattiesburg, Mississippi as part of an incentive agreement with the state that includes a $75 million dollar loan and other tax and training incentives.

properties.name: W Solar Group
properties.information: The move of W Solar Group to Wisconsin will create 600 jobs and the project represents a capital investment of over $300 million. There exists an undisclosed manufacturing facility that will build CIGS thin-film solar cells starting in 2012.

properties.name: Kyocera
properties.information: Kyocera plans to expand its photovoltaic cell output 2.5-fold to 1 million kilowatts in fiscal 2012.

properties.name: Solar Power Inc.
properties.information: The facility will be 100,000 square feet with an annual production capacity of 50MW of Solar Power, Inc.'s PV panels.

properties.name: Hemlock Semiconductor Corp.
properties.information: The plant will cost $1.2 billion dollars and produce polysilicon, a raw material used to make solar cells and semiconductor devices.

properties.name: Sanyo
properties.information: The plant will be producing silicon ingots and wafers and core materials to manufacture Sanyo?s patented HIT solar cells and modules. The plant plans to reach its full capacity of 70MW.

properties.name: Wanxiang America Corporation
properties.information: A $2 million dollar project in two years will start out churning out 50,000 solar panels a year. The facility immediately generated 60 new jobs.

properties.name: Schott Solar
properties.information: The current facility represents a $100M investment, employs 350 people, and at full capacity will produce 85MW of photovoltaic panels and 200MW of trough receiver tubes annually.

properties.name: Abound Solar
properties.information: The fully automated facility will create more than 300 new jobs and, when at capacity, will produce 200MW of solar modules annually.

properties.name: First Solar
properties.information: The expansion is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2010 and will increase the annual capacity at the Perrysburg facility to approximately 192 megawatts.

properties.name: Optisolar
properties.information: Optisolar and Sunpower Corp. entered into a contract  commitment that will deliver PV energy of around 1.65 billion kilowatt-hours of renewable energy annually. This would be equivalent to the amount of energy needed to serve approximately 239,000 residential homes each year.

properties.name: SunPower Corporation
properties.information: Optisolar and Sunpower Corp. entered into a contract  commitment that will deliver PV energy of around 1.65 billion kilowatt-hours of renewable energy annually. This would be equivalent to the amount of energy needed to serve approximately 239,000 residential homes each year.

properties.name: ZBB Battery
properties.information: ZBB is using $1.3 million in Recovery Act funding through the Department of Energy's State Energy Program to help fund a $4.5 million factory renovation, allowing the company to triple their capacity to manufacture flow batteries and power systems.

properties.name: Helios USA
properties.information: The facility is going to create approximately 50 new jobs. Also, the annual production capacity is currently 40MW. However, the company is preparing to ramp up to 120MW in terms of square footage and installed power supply.

properties.name: Pinnacle Biofuels Inc.
properties.information: The new plant in Crossett now employs about 20 people and produces 28,000 to 30,000 gallons of biodiesel a day. Officials say the plant can produce up to 10 million gallons of biodiesel annually. The plant uses vegetable oils and animal fats to make the fuel.

properties.name: Future Fuel Chemical Comp.
properties.information: Future Fuel operates the24MMgy biodiesel manufacturing facility with around 400 employees.

properties.name: Patriot BioFuels
properties.information: Patriot BioFuels has announced its intention to quadruple annual production of biodiesel to 13 million gallons per year, up from 3 million gallons with the addition of the new Stuttgart plant.

properties.name: Pacific Ethanol, Inc.
properties.information: The Union Pacific Railroad will deliver 10 rail car loads of feedstock a week to the facility in Idaho which plans to produce 60 Mgy of ethanol.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This ethanol facility uses a dry-grind production method to produce the alcohol in a 350-acre bio-refinery.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facility produces ethanol using dry-grind production method in a 78-acre bio-refinery.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facilty produces 110 million gallons of ethanol per year, processes enarly 40 million bushels of corn per year, and produces 350,000 tons of distiller grains.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facility produces standard ethanol using dry-grind production method in a 420-acre facility.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facilty produces 110 million gallons of ethanol per year, processes enarly 40 million bushels of corn per year, and produces 350,000 tons of distiller grains.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facility produces standard ethanol using dry-grind production method in a 225-acre facility.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facility produces standard ethanol using dry-grind production method in a 270-acre facility.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facility produces standard ethanol using dry-grind production method in a 344-acre facility.

properties.name: Valero
properties.information: This facilty on an 80-acre facility produces 110 million gallons of ethanol per year, processes enarly 40 million bushels of corn per year, and produces 350,000 tons of distiller grains.

properties.name: Voyager Ethanol
properties.information: Voyager Ethanol is expected to process approximately 21 million bushels of corn annually into 50 million gallons of ethanol per year.

properties.name: Horizon Wind Energy
properties.information: The site produces enough power to power about 120,000 homes, or approximately 1.3 billion kilowatt hours annually.

properties.name: Alliant Energy
properties.information: Located in Franklin County, Iowa, the wind farm has a capacity of 200MW. It consists of 121 wind turbines spread out over roughly 140 square kilometres (54 sq mi).

properties.name: BP
properties.information: BP Wind Energy?s 50 MW of the electrical power from the wind farm has been sold to Westar Energy under a long-term power purchase agreement and the remaining 50 MW are owned by Westar Energy. BP operates the full 100 MW.

properties.name: AMP & Kenergy
properties.information: The 84-megawatt run-of-the-river project, called the Cannelton Hydroelectric Plant, will cost $419 million and will take four years to build

properties.name: Ocean Renewable Power Company
properties.information: In late 2011, following FERC approval, ORPC will begin the Maine Tidal Energy Project by installing a commercial TidGen? Power System in Cobscook Bay.

properties.name: Heat Transfer International
properties.information: The system at Sietsema Farm Feeds is capable of handling 4,000 to 5,000 pounds, or 35 tons, of turkey litter per day, although this type of system uses a fixed-bed gasifier and can handle nearly any type of biomass, as long as size and moisture content is previously configured.

properties.name: Hydro Green Energy LLC
properties.information: Hydro Green Energy is installing a two-turbine Hydro+ project downstream from its 4.4MW run-of-river hydropower plant. Once the electrical systems are tested, the hydrokinetic turbine will send electricity to the Minnesota electric power grid.

properties.name: Piney Woods Pellets LLC
properties.information: The plant should produce 50,000 tons of pellets each year. The pellets will act as feedstock for alternative energy.

properties.name: NaturEner
properties.information: The giant wind turbines will supply 106.5 MW of wind energy at full production, employing a total of seventy-one 1.5 MW wind turbines.

properties.name: Edison Mission Group
properties.information: The largest wind energy facility in the state, Elkhorn Ridge can generate up to 80 megawatts (MW) of power, enough energy on an annual basis to meet the needs of approximately 25,000 homes.

properties.name: Iberdrola Renewables
properties.information: The project?s 12 wind turbines span 1,500-acres and generate 24MW of electricity annually to power around 10,000 New Hampshire homes.

properties.name: Horizon Wind Energy
properties.information: The farm houses 120 wind turbines, the Maple Ridge Wind Farm can produce approximately 240 megawatts (MW) online that provide electricity for about 60,000 residents.

properties.name: VeraSun Energy Corp.
properties.information: The 220-acre site generating 110 million gallons of ethanol will annually process approximately 39 million bushels of corn and produce about 350,000 tons of distillers grains for livestock feed.

properties.name: Iberdrola Renewables
properties.information: This wind farm houses 71 turbines on 16.4 miles of road and operations building in Pierce County and generates 149MW of electricity.

properties.name: Accioa
properties.information: This wind farm 82 ACCIONA Windpower 1.5 MW wind turbines, Red Hills Wind Farm is able to generate enough clean energy to power over 40,000 U.S. homes and offset approximately 294,000 tons of CO2 emissions annually.

properties.name: Green Gas Americas Inc.
properties.information: The project uses gas from the Pioneer Crossing landfill, which would normally be lost through flaring, to produce 6.4MW of electricity.

properties.name: KL Energy Corp.
properties.information: The cellulosic ethanol plant uses waste wood to produce 1.5 million gallons of ethanol annually.

properties.name: MGE
properties.information: The farm has 17 turbines that produce 23 million kWh annually.

properties.name: Dominion & Shell WindEnergy Inc.
properties.information: The project consists of 132 wind turbines along 12 miles of the Allegheny Front and can generates 264MW annually enough electricity to serve about 66,000 homes and businesses.

properties.name: PPM Energy
properties.information: The wind farm consists of 133 GE Energy 1.5 MW turbines and generates 200MW annually.

properties.name: Babcock & Brown Renewable Holdings Inc.
properties.information: The wind farm consists of 34 General Electric 1.5-megawatt wind turbines that are expected to generate enough clean and renewable energy to power 15,000 homes per year.

properties.name: NA
properties.information: This waste food gasification plant uses existing waste products from sawmills, logging and timber operations in the Midlands to produce 60,000 pounds of steam per hour (about 85 percent of campus steam needs), ~1MW of electricity.

properties.name: Winergy Drive Systems Corp. & Siemens Drive Technologies
properties.information: This wind turbine production facility will create approximately 300 new jobs in production and 55 new office jobs over the next three to four years, more than double the current number of employees in Elgin.

properties.name: GE Wind Energy LLC
properties.information: This GE facility manufactures 1.5MW wind turbines.

properties.name: GE Wind Energy LLC
properties.information: This GE facility manufactures 1.5MW wind turbines.

properties.name: GE Wind Energy LLC
properties.information: This GE facility manufactures 1.5MW wind turbines.

properties.name: Green Shine New Energy Company, Ltd.
properties.information: This firm generates small-scale PV panels to power lights as well as large scale PV.

properties.name: G.S. Battery USA
properties.information: GS Battery assembles Valve-regulated Lead-Acid Batteries (VRLA), motorcycle batteries, Li-ion batteries, power supplies and lighting equipment.

properties.name: Evergreen Solar
properties.information: Evergreen Solar manufactures 215-220W silicon PV panels.

properties.name: First Solar
properties.information:
This facility's line was expanded to a more automated line producing 25MW by 2005. In March of 2010, the Perrysburg facility was expanded
to 900,000 square feet consisting of one plant equaling four manufacturing lines, offices, and research and development capabilities.

properties.name: AC Propulsion, Inc.
properties.information: In 1994, AC Propulsion unveiled the AC-150, an innovative 200 horsepower integrated drive system for compact to mid-size passenger cars that attained 0-60 mph acceleration in 6.2 seconds and a 145-mile range. In 2006, AC Propulsion created the eBox, the world's first vehicle-to-grid (V2G) capable electric vehicle.

properties.name: Electric Fuel Corporation
properties.information: Electric Fuel Corp. is the military division of Arotech dealing with primary and rechargable battery technologies.

properties.name: Symmetry Resources, Inc.
properties.information: Symmetry Resources consults, assembles battery packs, and does extensive battery research.
